summary: The Croatia national football team, nicknamed the Vatreni, represents Croatia in international football. They are part of UEFA in Europe and FIFA globally. Known for their checkered uniforms, they have qualified for most major tournaments since 1994, except UEFA Euro 2000 and the 2010 FIFA World Cup. Croatia has won three World Cup medals, including a second-place finish in 2018. They have also reached the quarter-finals of the UEFA European Championship twice. Despite being a small country, Croatia has achieved remarkable success in football, including fastest ascension in FIFA rankings and unique records in penalty shoot-outs.
title: Croatia national football team
